ground_truth: They consider the police car a moment more. Kyle hands the shotgun over to Bob. Charlie's face lights up when she sees the police car. The door of the police car opens as Charlie races from the diner. The three men see her moving toward the car. Jeep's face goes slack. The men begin to run toward her. While out of the police car steps. Charlie freezes a few feet from the car when she sees those piercing eyes already familiar to us. Michael looks at her, as if she were exactly who he expected to see. In moments Bob, Kyle, and Jeep form a protective shield in front of Charlie. Bob raises the shotgun. A long beat as Michael considers Bob. Michael stares at him blankly. Michael offers up a dangerous smile, revealing a not so well-kept but definitely normal set of teeth. Bob and the others ease slightly. Bob lowers the gun. Michael remains silent. Bob chuckles for a moment. When Michael doesn't respond in kind, Bob falls silent. He slowly raises the shotgun again. Michael sizes up this raggedy group. His gaze drifts over to the loosely wrapped body in front of the diner. The plastic table cloth flaps wildly in the wind. Turning back to Bob. Michael just shakes his head. Michael steps toward Charlie with a sense of purpose, but Bob blocks his path, brandishing the shotgun. That's when Kyle Michael something out in the direction of the road. Michael whips the gun away from Bob's head and thrusts it back into his hands. Bob looks down at the gun, speechless. Michael walks swiftly around to the trunk of the cruiser. Pops it, revealing a staggering arsenal of weaponry. Michael's eyes narrow, studying Jeep. Michael pulls out twin MP5s for himself. Boxes of shotgun shells. A flicker of light. And then flashlight beams cut through the darkness, coming to rest on Michael's pale face. Michael looks up at the ceiling. A hatch opens and out comes Michael followed by Bob, Percy, and Kyle. Michael is about to answer, when two headlights appear in the darkness. And sure enough, an ice cream truck rolls slowly toward the diner. It's too dark to see who's behind the wheel. The men quickly do as they're told. Kyle and Bob shoot quick anxious looks at Percy. Charlie and Audrey peer between the slats covering the windows. The ice cream truck's headlights fan across the diner. Audrey and Charlie back away from the windows. Charlie stops next to Jeep. Rests a hand on his arm. Howard smiles weakly at the familiar sound of the calliope. The ice cream truck pulls to a stop with its headlights facing the diner. Everyone aims their guns at the truck.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: They regard the patrol vehicle a minute more. Kyle passes the firearm over to Bob. Charlie's visage illuminates when she notices the patrol vehicle. The portal of the patrol vehicle opens as Charlie speeds from the eatery. The trio of males observe her advancing toward the vehicle. Jeep's expression goes lax. The males commence to sprint toward her. While out of the patrol vehicle strides. Charlie halts a few feet from the vehicle when she perceives those penetrating eyes already known to us. Michael observes her, as though she were precisely whom he anticipated to encounter. In instants Bob, Kyle, and Jeep create a protective barrier in front of Charlie. Bob elevates the firearm. A lengthy pause as Michael contemplates Bob. Michael gazes at him impassively. Michael presents a perilous grin, exposing a not so well-maintained yet certainly ordinary set of teeth. Bob and the others relax marginally. Bob lowers the firearm. Michael stays mute. Bob chuckles briefly. When Michael doesn't reciprocate, Bob becomes mute. He gradually raises the firearm once more. Michael evaluates this raggedy group. His stare drifts over to the loosely wrapped figure in front of the eatery. The plastic tablecloth flutters wildly in the breeze. Turning back to Bob. Michael merely shakes his head. Michael strides toward Charlie with a sense of intent, but Bob obstructs his route, brandishing the firearm. That's when Kyle alerts Michael to something out in the direction of the road. Michael jerks the firearm away from Bob's cranium and propels it back into his hands. Bob glances down at the firearm, speechless. Michael strides briskly around to the trunk of the cruiser. Pops it, disclosing a staggering stockpile of weapons. Michael's eyes narrow, examining Jeep. Michael pulls out dual MP5s for himself. Boxes of firearm shells. A shimmer of light. And then flashlight beams pierce through the darkness, coming to rest on Michael's pale visage. Michael glances up at the ceiling. A hatch opens and out emerges Michael followed by Bob, Percy, and Kyle. Michael is about to reply, when two headlights emerge in the obscurity. And indeed, a dessert vehicle rolls slowly toward the eatery. It's too dim to discern who's behind the wheel. The males hastily comply as they're instructed. Kyle and Bob cast quick tense glances at Percy. Charlie and Audrey peer between the slats covering the panes. The dessert vehicle's headlights spread across the eatery. Audrey and Charlie retreat from the panes. Charlie stops next to Jeep. Places a hand on his limb. Howard smiles faintly at the familiar sound of the calliope. The dessert vehicle comes to a stop with its headlights directed at the eatery. Everyone aims their firearms at the vehicle.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: They consider the police car briefly. Kyle hands the shotgun to Bob. Charlie's face lights up at the sight of the police car. As the car door opens, Charlie races from the diner, and the three men see her heading toward it. Jeep's face goes slack, and they run after her. Charlie freezes a few feet from the car, recognizing the familiar piercing eyes. Michael looks at her as if expecting her. Bob, Kyle, and Jeep form a protective shield around Charlie. Bob raises the shotgun. Michael considers Bob, offering a dangerous smile with normal teeth. Bob and the others relax slightly, and Bob lowers the gun. Michael remains silent, and Bob chuckles briefly but falls silent when Michael doesn't respond. Bob raises the shotgun again. Michael assesses the group, his gaze drifting to the loosely wrapped body by the diner. The plastic tablecloth flaps in the wind. Michael shakes his head and steps toward Charlie, but Bob blocks him with the shotgun. Kyle points something out toward the road. Michael whips the gun from Bob's head and thrusts it back into his hands. Bob is speechless. Michael swiftly moves to the cruiser trunk, revealing a staggering arsenal. He narrows his eyes at Jeep, pulling out twin MP5s and boxes of shotgun shells. Flashlight beams cut through the darkness, illuminating Michael's face. A hatch opens, and Michael emerges, followed by Bob, Percy, and Kyle. Michael is about to speak when headlights appear, revealing an ice cream truck rolling toward the diner. It's too dark to see the driver. The men quickly follow orders. Kyle and Bob exchange anxious looks with Percy. Charlie and Audrey peer through the window slats. The truck's headlights fan across the diner, and Audrey and Charlie back away. Charlie stops next to Jeep, resting a hand on his arm. Howard smiles weakly at the calliope's familiar sound. The ice cream truck stops with its headlights facing the diner, and everyone aims their guns at it.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: They consider the police car briefly. Kyle gives Bob the shotgun. Charlie's face lights up at the sight of the police car. As the car door opens, Charlie races from the diner. The men see her heading toward the car. Jeep's face goes slack, and they run after her. Charlie freezes near the car, recognizing the familiar piercing eyes. Michael looks at her, as if expecting her. Bob, Kyle, and Jeep form a protective shield around Charlie. Bob raises the shotgun. Michael considers Bob, offering a dangerous smile with normal teeth. Bob and the others relax slightly, lowering the gun. Bob chuckles, but when Michael doesn't respond, he raises the shotgun again. Michael assesses the group, glancing at the loosely wrapped body by the diner. The tablecloth flaps in the wind. Michael shakes his head and steps toward Charlie, but Bob blocks him with the shotgun. Kyle points out something on the road. Michael takes the gun from Bob and thrusts it back. Bob is speechless. Michael opens the cruiser trunk, revealing an arsenal. He pulls out twin MP5s and boxes of shotgun shells. Flashlight beams illuminate Michael's face. A hatch opens, and Michael, Bob, Percy, and Kyle emerge. As Michael is about to speak, headlights appear, revealing an ice cream truck approaching the diner. It's too dark to see the driver. The men follow orders quickly. Kyle and Bob exchange anxious looks with Percy. Charlie and Audrey peer through the window slats. The truck's headlights sweep across the diner. Audrey and Charlie back away, and Charlie stops next to Jeep, resting a hand on his arm. Howard smiles weakly at the calliope sound. The truck stops with headlights facing the diner, and everyone aims their guns at it.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: They take a moment longer to consider the police car, their eyes lingering on it with a mix of curiosity and apprehension. Kyle, with a deliberate motion, hands the shotgun over to Bob, who accepts it with a nod. Charlie's face lights up with excitement and recognition when she catches sight of the police car. As the door of the police car swings open, Charlie races out of the diner with urgency. The three men, observing her determined movement toward the car, react quickly. Jeep's face goes slack with surprise. The men, sensing the need for action, begin to run toward her with haste. Just then, someone steps out of the police car. Charlie comes to an abrupt halt a few feet from the vehicle when she notices those piercing eyes, already familiar to us. Michael looks at her with an expression that suggests she is exactly who he anticipated seeing. In a matter of moments, Bob, Kyle, and Jeep form a protective shield in front of Charlie, their bodies tense with readiness. Bob raises the shotgun, prepared for whatever might come next. A long, tense beat follows as Michael considers Bob, staring at him with a blank expression. Michael then offers a dangerous smile, revealing a set of teeth that, while not perfectly kept, are certainly normal. Bob and the others ease slightly, sensing no immediate threat. Bob lowers the gun, but Michael remains silent, his demeanor unchanged. Bob chuckles briefly, attempting to lighten the mood, but when Michael doesn't respond in kind, Bob falls silent once more. He slowly raises the shotgun again, unsure of what to expect. Michael sizes up this raggedy group, his gaze drifting over to the loosely wrapped body lying in front of the diner. The plastic tablecloth covering it flaps wildly in the wind, adding to the scene's tension. Turning his attention back to Bob, Michael just shakes his head, a gesture of mild disapproval or perhaps resignation. Michael steps toward Charlie with a sense of purpose, but Bob blocks his path, brandishing the shotgun with renewed determination. That's when Kyle notices something out in the direction of the road and alerts Michael. In a swift motion, Michael whips the gun away from Bob's head and thrusts it back into his hands. Bob looks down at the gun, speechless and bewildered. Michael walks swiftly around to the trunk of the cruiser, popping it open to reveal a staggering arsenal of weaponry. Michael's eyes narrow as he studies Jeep, assessing him with a critical eye. He pulls out twin MP5s for himself, along with boxes of shotgun shells. A flicker of light catches their attention, and then flashlight beams cut through the darkness, coming to rest on Michael's pale face. Michael looks up at the ceiling, and a hatch opens, allowing him to emerge, followed by Bob, Percy, and Kyle. Michael is about to answer a question when two headlights appear in the darkness, and sure enough, an ice cream truck rolls slowly toward the diner. It's too dark to discern who's behind the wheel, adding to the mystery. The men quickly do as they're told, their movements quick and anxious. Kyle and Bob exchange quick, anxious looks with Percy, their concern evident. Charlie and Audrey peer between the slats covering the windows, trying to get a better view. The ice cream truck's headlights fan across the diner, casting an eerie glow. Audrey and Charlie back away from the windows, their apprehension growing. Charlie stops next to Jeep, resting a reassuring hand on his arm. Howard smiles weakly at the familiar sound of the calliope, a sound that brings back memories. The ice cream truck pulls to a stop with its headlights facing the diner, and everyone aims their guns at the truck, ready for whatever might happen next.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: They take a moment longer, allowing their eyes to linger on the police car, scrutinizing it with a mixture of genuine curiosity and underlying apprehension. Kyle, moving with purposeful intent, hands the shotgun over to Bob, who acknowledges the gesture with a subtle nod. Charlie’s face lights up with a mixture of excitement and recognition the instant she catches sight of the police car. As the door of the police car swings open with a creak, Charlie races out of the diner, driven by a sense of urgency. The three men, observing her determined sprint toward the car, react with immediacy. Jeep’s face goes slack, overtaken by surprise. The men, sensing the immediate need for action, start to run after her with increased speed. Just then, someone steps out of the police car. Charlie comes to an abrupt stop just a few feet from the vehicle when she notices those piercing eyes, already well-known to us. Michael looks at her with an expression that suggests she is precisely who he anticipated encountering. Within moments, Bob, Kyle, and Jeep form a protective barrier in front of Charlie, their bodies tense, ready for whatever might come next. Bob raises the shotgun, poised and prepared. A long, tense beat follows as Michael observes Bob, staring at him with a blank, unreadable expression. Michael then offers a smile, one that carries a hint of danger, revealing teeth that, though not perfectly kept, appear normal. Bob and the others ease slightly, sensing no immediate threat from Michael. Bob lowers the gun, but Michael's silence and unchanged demeanor keep the tension alive. Bob chuckles briefly in a vain attempt to lighten the mood; however, when Michael does not reciprocate the gesture, Bob falls silent once again. He slowly raises the shotgun again, uncertain and wary of what might unfold. Michael sizes up this raggedy group, his gaze drifting over to the loosely wrapped body lying in front of the diner. The plastic tablecloth covering it flaps wildly in the gusty wind, adding another layer to the scene's tension. Returning his attention to Bob, Michael merely shakes his head—a gesture that could signify mild disapproval or perhaps resignation. Michael steps forward toward Charlie with clear purpose, but Bob intercepts his path, holding the shotgun with renewed determination. That's when Kyle notices something out in the direction of the road and urgently alerts Michael. In one swift, fluid motion, Michael whips the gun away from Bob's head, thrusting it back into his hands. Bob looks down at the gun, speechless and bewildered by the sudden action. Michael strides swiftly around to the trunk of the cruiser, opening it to reveal an astonishing arsenal of weaponry. Michael's eyes narrow as he critically studies Jeep, evaluating him. He pulls out twin MP5s for himself, along with several boxes of shotgun shells. A flicker of light captures their attention, and flashlight beams pierce the darkness, casting their glow on Michael's pale face. Michael looks up at the ceiling, and a hatch opens, allowing him to emerge, followed in quick succession by Bob, Percy, and Kyle. Michael is on the brink of answering a question when the appearance of two headlights cutting through the darkness signals the slow approach of an ice cream truck toward the diner. It is too dark to discern who might be behind the wheel, adding layers to the growing mystery. The men hastily follow instructions, their movements quick and filled with anxious energy. Kyle and Bob exchange quick, anxious glances with Percy, their concern unmistakable. Inside the diner, Charlie and Audrey peer between the slats covering the windows, straining to get a clearer view. The ice cream truck's headlights sweep across the diner, casting an eerie, unsettling glow. Audrey and Charlie back away from the windows, their apprehension mounting. Charlie stops next to Jeep, resting a reassuring hand on his arm in solidarity. Howard smiles weakly at the familiar sound of the calliope, a sound that stirs old memories. The ice cream truck grinds to a halt, its headlights focused on the diner, and everyone aims their weapons at the truck, bracing for whatever might happen next.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: They continue to gaze at the police car, contemplating its presence for a moment longer. Kyle, with a deliberate motion, hands the shotgun over to Bob, transferring the weight and responsibility of the weapon. As Charlie catches sight of the police car, her face brightens with excitement and recognition. The door of the police car swings open just as Charlie, filled with urgency, dashes out from the diner, her feet pounding against the ground. The three men, Bob, Kyle, and Jeep, notice her swift movement toward the car, their eyes tracking her progress. Jeep's expression goes blank, his face slackening in surprise or concern. The men, driven by a shared sense of urgency, begin to sprint toward her, their feet moving in unison. Meanwhile, a figure steps out of the police car, and Charlie comes to an abrupt halt a few feet away, her body freezing as she locks eyes with those piercing eyes that are already familiar to us. Michael, standing there, looks at her with an expression that suggests she is exactly who he anticipated seeing. In a matter of moments, Bob, Kyle, and Jeep position themselves protectively in front of Charlie, forming a human shield. Bob, with a steady hand, raises the shotgun, ready to defend. A tense pause ensues as Michael considers Bob, his gaze unwavering. Michael stares at him with a blank expression, offering a dangerous smile that reveals a set of teeth that, while not perfectly kept, are undeniably normal. The tension eases slightly as Bob and the others relax, Bob lowering the gun cautiously. Michael remains silent, his demeanor unchanged. Bob lets out a brief chuckle, attempting to lighten the mood, but when Michael doesn't reciprocate, Bob's laughter fades, and he falls silent. Slowly, with a sense of resignation, Bob raises the shotgun once more. Michael takes a moment to assess this ragtag group, his eyes scanning over them before drifting to the loosely wrapped body lying in front of the diner, the plastic tablecloth flapping wildly in the wind. Turning his attention back to Bob, Michael simply shakes his head, a gesture of disapproval or disbelief. With a determined stride, Michael steps toward Charlie, but Bob blocks his path, brandishing the shotgun as a warning. At that moment, Kyle points out something in the direction of the road, drawing Michael's attention. In a swift motion, Michael whips the gun away from Bob's head and thrusts it back into his hands, leaving Bob speechless as he looks down at the weapon. Michael moves quickly around to the trunk of the cruiser, popping it open to reveal a staggering arsenal of weaponry. His eyes narrow as he studies Jeep, assessing him. Michael selects twin MP5s for himself, along with boxes of shotgun shells, preparing for what lies ahead. A flicker of light catches their attention, and flashlight beams pierce through the darkness, illuminating Michael's pale face. Michael glances upward at the ceiling, and a hatch opens, allowing him to emerge, followed by Bob, Percy, and Kyle. Just as Michael is about to speak, two headlights appear in the darkness, and an ice cream truck rolls slowly toward the diner, its driver obscured by the shadows. The men, following Michael's lead, quickly comply with his unspoken command. Kyle and Bob exchange quick, anxious glances with Percy, their concern evident. Inside, Charlie and Audrey peer through the slats covering the windows, their eyes wide with apprehension. The ice cream truck's headlights sweep across the diner, casting an eerie glow. Audrey and Charlie instinctively back away from the windows, retreating into the safety of the interior. Charlie stops beside Jeep, resting a reassuring hand on his arm, seeking comfort in his presence. Howard, standing nearby, smiles weakly at the familiar sound of the calliope emanating from the truck. The ice cream truck comes to a halt, its headlights fixed on the diner, casting a spotlight on the tense scene. Everyone, with a shared sense of urgency and determination, aims their guns at the truck, ready for whatever may come next.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: They briefly consider the police car before Kyle hands the shotgun to Bob. Charlie's excitement is evident as she spots the police car and races from the diner, catching the attention of the three men who start running toward her. As the car door opens, Charlie freezes, recognizing the familiar piercing eyes of Michael, who seems to have expected her. Bob, Kyle, and Jeep quickly form a protective barrier around Charlie, with Bob raising the shotgun. Michael regards Bob with a dangerous smile, causing the men to relax slightly, and Bob lowers the gun. However, when Michael remains silent, Bob chuckles awkwardly before raising the shotgun again. Michael assesses the group and glances at the loosely wrapped body by the diner, the tablecloth flapping in the wind. He shakes his head and steps toward Charlie, but Bob blocks him with the shotgun. Kyle points something out on the road, prompting Michael to disarm Bob and return the gun to him. Speechless, Bob watches as Michael moves to the cruiser’s trunk, revealing an arsenal of weapons. Michael selects twin MP5s and boxes of shotgun shells, his eyes narrowing as he studies Jeep. Flashlight beams suddenly illuminate Michael's face, and he looks up as a hatch opens, allowing him, Bob, Percy, and Kyle to emerge. Just as Michael is about to speak, an ice cream truck appears in the darkness, rolling slowly toward the diner. The men follow instructions quickly, with Kyle and Bob exchanging anxious glances with Percy. Inside, Charlie and Audrey peer through the window slats as the truck's headlights sweep across the diner, prompting them to back away. Charlie stops beside Jeep, resting a hand on his arm, while Howard weakly smiles at the familiar calliope sound. The truck halts with its headlights facing the diner, and everyone aims their guns at it.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: They consider the police car, a Ford Crown Victoria often used by police departments for its durability, a moment more. Kyle hands the shotgun, a Remington 870 known for its reliability, over to Bob. Charlie's face lights up when she sees the police car, a familiar symbol of authority and protection. The door of the police car opens as Charlie races from the diner, a small roadside eatery known for its homemade pies. The three men see her moving toward the car. Jeep's face goes slack, a reaction from a man who seldom shows emotion. The men begin to run toward her. While out of the police car steps an imposing figure. Charlie freezes a few feet from the car when she sees those piercing eyes already familiar to us from a previous encounter. Michael, exuding an air of confidence, looks at her as if she were exactly who he expected to see. In moments Bob, Kyle, and Jeep, ordinary guys who recently learned to use firearms, form a protective shield in front of Charlie. Bob raises the shotgun. A long beat as Michael considers Bob carefully, assessing the situation. Michael stares at him blankly, revealing little of his thoughts. Michael offers up a dangerous smile, revealing a not so well-kept but definitely normal set of teeth, an unexpected feature that softens his menacing demeanor. Bob and the others ease slightly. Bob lowers the gun. Michael remains silent, maintaining a calm presence. Bob chuckles for a moment. When Michael doesn't respond in kind, Bob falls silent. He slowly raises the shotgun again, uncertain of Michael's intentions. Michael sizes up this raggedy group, who appear far from professional soldiers. His gaze drifts over to the loosely wrapped body in front of the diner, indicating previous violence. The plastic table cloth flaps wildly in the wind, a stark reminder of the discord around them. Turning back to Bob, Michael just shakes his head, conveying a wordless dismissal. Michael steps toward Charlie with a sense of purpose, but Bob blocks his path, brandishing the shotgun as a barrier. That's when Kyle spots something unusual and alerts Michael to it in the direction of the road. Michael whips the gun away from Bob's head and thrusts it back into his hands. Bob looks down at the gun, speechless at the unexpected gesture. Michael walks swiftly around to the trunk of the cruiser, a compartment he knows well. Pops it, revealing a staggering arsenal of weaponry, enough to equip a small army. Michael's eyes narrow, studying Jeep, as if gauging his readiness. Michael pulls out twin MP5s for himself, favored by special forces for close-quarters combat. Boxes of shotgun shells, enough for a long standoff. A flicker of light. And then flashlight beams, used by the men for visibility, cut through the darkness, coming to rest on Michael's pale face. Michael looks up at the ceiling. A hatch opens and out comes Michael followed by Bob, Percy, and Kyle, climbing warily. Michael is about to answer, when two headlights appear in the darkness. And sure enough, an ice cream truck, an unlikely vehicle for such a scene, rolls slowly toward the diner. It's too dark to see who's behind the wheel, adding to the tension. The men quickly do as they're told. Kyle and Bob shoot quick anxious looks at Percy, who remains the calm and steady one. Charlie and Audrey peer between the slats covering the windows, trying to get a better view. The ice cream truck's headlights fan across the diner, casting eerie shadows. Audrey and Charlie back away from the windows, sensing danger. Charlie stops next to Jeep, rests a hand on his arm for reassurance. Howard smiles weakly at the familiar sound of the calliope, a melody reminiscent of childhood days. The ice cream truck pulls to a stop with its headlights facing the diner. Everyone aims their guns at the truck, ready for whatever comes next.

Michael whips the gun away from Bob's head and thrusts it back into his hands. Bob looks down at the gun speechless. Michael walks swiftly around to the trunk of the cruiser. Pops it revealing a staggering arsenal of weaponry. Michael's eyes narrow studying Jeep. Michael pulls out twin MP5s for himself. Boxes of shotgun shells. A flicker of light. And then flashlight beams cut through the darkness coming to rest on Michael's pale face. Michael looks up at the ceiling. A hatch opens and out comes Michael followed by Bob Percy and Kyle. Michael is about to answer when two headlights appear in the darkness. And sure enough an ice cream truck rolls slowly toward the diner. It is too dark to see who is behind the wheel. The men quickly do as they are told. Kyle and Bob shoot quick anxious looks at Percy. Charlie and Audrey peer between the slats covering the windows. The ice cream truck's headlights fan across the diner. Audrey and Charlie back away from the windows. Charlie stops next to Jeep. Rests a hand on his arm. Howard smiles weakly at the familiar sound of the calliope. The ice cream truck pulls to a stop with its headlights facing the diner. Everyone aims their guns at the truck.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: They consider the police car a moment more. Kyle hands the shotgun over to Bob. Charlie's face lights up when she sees the police car. The door of the police car opens as Charlie races from the diner. The three men see her moving toward the car. Jeep's face goes slack. The men begin to run toward her. While out of the police car steps. Charlie freezes a few feet from the car when she sees those piercing eyes already familiar to us. Michael looks at her as if she were exactly who he expected to see. In moments Bob Kyle and Jeep form a protective shield in front of Charlie. Bob raises the shotgun. A long beat as Michael considers Bob. Michael stares at him blankly. Michael offers up a dangerous smile revealing a not so wellkept but definitely normal set of teeth. Bob and the others ease slightly. Bob lowers the gun. Michael remains silent. Bob chuckles for a moment. When Michael does not respond in kind Bob falls silent. He slowly raises the shotgun again. Michael sizes up this raggedy group. His gaze drifts over to the loosely wrapped body in front of the diner. The plastic table cloth flaps wildly in the wind. Turning back to Bob Michael just shakes his head. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: They ponder the sailboat a bit longer. Roger hands the telescope over to Sam. Taylor's face brightens when he sees the sailboat. The hatch of the sailboat swings open as Taylor dashes from the bakery. The three birds notice him gliding toward the boat. Max's beak goes limp. The birds start to flutter toward him. While out of the sailboat hops. Taylor halts a few inches from the boat when he notices those brilliant feathers already known to us. Alex glances at him, as if he was precisely who he planned to encounter. In moments, Sam, Roger, and Max arrange a defensive wall in front of Taylor. Sam raises the telescope. A prolonged pause as Alex evaluates Sam. Alex gazes at him indifferently. Alex flashes a perilous grin, revealing a not so tidy yet entirely common set of scales. Sam and the others relax marginally. Sam lowers the instrument. Alex stays silent. Sam giggles for an instant. When Alex doesn't mirror the gesture, Sam grows quiet. He cautiously raises the telescope once more. Alex measures up this scruffy bunch. His eyes wander over to the loosely wrapped sculpture in front of the bakery. The picnic blanket flaps fiercely in the gust. Turning back to Sam. Alex merely shakes his head. Alex strides toward Taylor with determination, but Sam obstructs his way, wielding the telescope. That's when Roger signals something out in the direction of the bridge. Alex snatches the telescope away from Sam's grasp and flips it back into his arms. Sam gazes at the object, dumbfounded. Alex swiftly moves around to the trunk of the submarine. Unseals it, revealing a mind-boggling assortment of gadgets. Alex's eyes tighten, inspecting Max. Alex extracts matching binoculars for himself. Boxes of telescope lenses. A flash of brightness. And then laser beams slice through the shadows, landing on Alex's pale features. Alex glances up at the rafters. A portal opens and out comes Alex followed by Sam, Leo, and Roger. Alex is about to reply when two lanterns emerge in the gloom. And sure enough, a pastry truck glides gently toward the bakery. It's too dim to discern who's steering. The birds quickly comply. Roger and Sam cast swift nervous glances at Leo. Taylor and Jamie peer between the blinds covering the openings. The pastry truck's lanterns sweep across the bakery. Jamie and Taylor retreat from the openings. Taylor pauses beside Max. Places a feather on his wing. Oliver grins faintly at the familiar tune of the carillon. The pastry truck glides to a halt with its lanterns illuminating the bakery. Everyone points their binoculars at the truck.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Kyle hands Bob a shotgun as Charlie excitedly races toward a police car that catches her eye. As the car door opens, Michael steps out, and Charlie freezes, recognizing him. Bob, Kyle, and Jeep form a protective barrier around her, with Bob raising his shotgun at Michael. Michael's unsettling smile momentarily eases their tension, but Bob resumes his guard when Michael remains unresponsive. Michael examines the group and the covered body nearby, then purposefully approaches Charlie, only to be blocked by Bob. Michael suddenly reacts to something Kyle spots, disarming Bob and heading to the cruiser’s trunk, revealing an extensive arsenal. Michael pulls out weapons, and flashlight beams cut through the darkness. As a hatch opens, Michael, Bob, Percy, and Kyle emerge, just as an ice cream truck approaches the diner. Everyone tenses, unsure of the driver. As the truck stops with its headlights on the diner, the group aims their guns at it, while Charlie and Audrey nervously watch from the window.
